title: 一人一信要求海牙國際法庭查警察蓄意謀殺

replies.msg:
1. 請COPY ＆ PASTE發EMAIL或FAX
2. 請自發修改
3. 請識做QR CODE或者SHARE DOCUMENT嘅巴打絲打幫忙做文宣廣傳公開信
4. 請廣傳信件內容或增加最新資料


字數所限，請從這裡抄送完文包括所有報導及影片的連結
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uLYYp4iycD3UBpVtCp8wQav-1a6eH1KDlQGqnjcbz1M/edit?usp=sharing

簡潔版如下：

Information and Evidence Unit
Office of the Prosecutor
Post Office Box 19519
2500 CM The Hague
The Netherlands

E-mail: otp.informationdesk@icc-cpi.int
Facsimile: +31 70 515 8555

Dear Sir / Madam,

We are writing to express our concern over the brutal violence by the Hong Kong Police Force in the past 4 months, especially a case of an allegedly "murderous attempt" that happened on October 1st, 2019.

A Hong Kong police officer has attacked an 18-year-old protester with live ammunition at Tsuen Wan district in the afternoon on Tuesday, October 1st. Such an incident reflects a major escalation of force. The Hong Kong Police Commissioner has confirmed officially the shooting a few hours later, by claiming the officer has aimed the gun at the young protester's left shoulder.

On the same day, the Hong Kong Police Force has also confirmed six live rounds were fired at different scenes of clashes. Previously on September 29th, a female journalist from Indonesia was hit by a projectile on Sunday, September 29th, while covering the protest in Wanchai district. It has been confirmed she will lose her eyesight completely on one of her eyes. Ms. Veby Indah's lawyer Michael Vidler of Vidler & Co Solicitors has issued a statement on her behalf.

Although projectiles have been fired to warn and disperse the crowd at other protesting scenes, and serious injuries were caused as a result of rubber bullets and beanbags employed by the police, this is the first time a protester was hit with a live round since mid-June. Amnesty International Hong Kong Chapter has previously conducted an investigation on the Hong Kong Police's abuse of power.

The Hong Kong police officer who pointed his gun and open fired at the young protester, Tsang Chi Kin (曾志健), an 18-year-old secondary school boy's in a very short distance. The New York Times has broken down the incident with the video footage collected from various sources.

The Hospital Authority said that as of 8 pm (1300 BST) on October 1st, 51 people had been injured across Hong Kong today. Two were in critical condition and two in a serious condition.

As on October 2nd, 2:59am Eastern Time, the Wall Street Journal reports the condition of the injured teenage boy is undetermined.

Police also attacked the first aiders and the news reporters.

The Hong Kong SAR government has turned a blind eye to the heightened police-induced brutality and abuse and continues to refuse citizen's demands for an independent investigation committee to look into the current turmoil.

We, Hongkongers, are experiencing a humanitarian crisis and we hope to seek your attention and consent in launching an investigation into the current chaotic situation in Hong Kong. With faith in ICC's international, impartial status and connection with the UN, I do believe you are able and willing to save Hong Kong people from the violence caused by the government and police force of the city.

May justice be upheld.

Yours faithfully,
（請考慮用真名及真EMAIL）
Hong Kong citizens

REFERENCE:
Wall Street Journal
https://www.wsj.com/articles/student-shot-by-police-in-hong-kong-protest-is-the-bravest-type-cousin-says-11569958133

New York Times
https://www.nytimes.com/video/world/asia/100000006745719/hong-kong-protester-shot.html?fbclid=IwAR2KVvgb2TVwWSizurZjFyQ6pnJJV3XRAfMNHyT1J0iDvFEnLSnqrtj8WsQ

Contact of Vidler & Co Solicitors Ms. Veby Indah: Info@vidler-co.com

幫手改咗啲字眼formal啲，內容冇分別，大家可以參考用呢個version
改得長咗啲，分兩part post


Part 1
nformation and Evidence Unit
Office of the Prosecutor
Post Office Box 19519
2500 CM The Hague
The Netherlands

E-mail: otp.informationdesk@icc-cpi.int
Facsimile: +31 70 515 8555

Dear Sir / Madam,

I am writing to invite you to investigate and prosecute the Hong Kong Government and the Hong Kong Police Force in relation to their brutal violence in the past 4 months, especially a case of an allegedly "murderous attempt" that happened on 1st October 2019.

A Hong Kong police officer has attacked an 18-year-old protester with live ammunition at Tsuen Wan district in the afternoon on Tuesday, 1st October 2019. Such an incident reflects a major escalation of force. The Hong Kong Police Commissioner has confirmed officially the shooting a few hours later, by claiming the officer has aimed the gun at the young protester's left shoulder.

On the same day, the Hong Kong Police Force has also confirmed six live rounds were fired at different scenes of clashes.

Previously on September 29th, a female journalist from Indonesia was hit by a projectile on Sunday, while covering the protest in Wanchai district. According to Vidler & Co., solicitors of the said journalist, she will lose her eyesight completely on one eye.

Although projectiles have been fired to warn and disperse the crowd at other protesting scenes, and serious injuries were caused as a result of rubber bullets and beanbags employed by the police, this is the first time a protester was hit with a live round since mid-June. Amnesty International Hong Kong Chapter has previously conducted an investigation on the Hong Kong Police's abuse of power.

Your consideration and action will be much appreciated.

Yours faithfully,
